channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish bags dumped outside the 1 Portman Mews south, 21st July
item.description:
There are rubbish bags dumped outside the pavement of 1 Portman Mews south. One of the bag is left open and attracting pests.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Portman Mews South, Mayfair, London

item.title: Rubbish, Food waste, 21st July
item.description:
Every week at the top of Floyd Road Charlton by the shops. Loads of black bags have been dumped on floor they have been ripped open leaving food,waste e.t.c all over pavement and road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84,82,80,78,76,74,70,66,68,64,62,60,58,56,54,52,50,48,46,44,42,38A, Floyd Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike in middle of pavement, 21st July
item.description:
Couldn’t pass with buggy as Lime bike dumped in middle of road. Unfortunately an hourly occurrence generally because they are easily unlocked even by kids as young as 8 and then dumped after use

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ASB & flytipping, 21st July
item.description:
Clear evidence of anti social behaviour so comfortable they brought an additional chair to drink in public and dump their cans over the only bit of greenery for this area. Area needs CCTV. Sofa was dumped a month ago and still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Teal Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 100 new revolutionary communist party appeared, 21st July
item.description:
You recently cleaned 100 Marxism Today posters, now ~100 new posters have appeared

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stroud Green Road, Stroud Green, London

item.title: Construction waste dumped on Underwood Streer, 21st July
item.description:
Construction waste including bags of insulation and metal ducting has been dumped by builders from Unit 2, 30-40 Underwood St N1 7JQ outside their property. The rubbish has been there for several days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Underwood Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Can paving slabs at bottom end of road on even number side be inspected please?, 21st July
item.description:

item.title: Loose manhole cover, again, 21st July
item.description:
The manhole cover is loose, again. Can this be actioned as a priority and can a lasting solution be implemented for us not having to report this is loose every 3/4 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 671-679, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway blocked by overhanging bushes and shrubs, 21st July
item.description:
I have reported this problem some time ago. It is impossible to walk along this path. The road sign is completely hidden. Nearly impossible to load car boots when parked in bay facing rearward. This problem has existed for too long now. I’m not sure who is responsible for all this vegetation but I think it should all be chopped down to root level please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hattersfield Close, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unnecessary Personalised Bay, 20th July
item.description:
The personalised disabled bay at 43 Olinda Road is not being used by someone with genuine mobility needs. The resident walks unaided daily. Please reassess and remove the bay to free up space for those who truly need it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Olinda Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
